Jokowi Butuh Bantuan Swasta Rp 1.435 T untuk Bangun Infrastruktur
06 Nov 2019, 07:17 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Foto: Agung Pambudhy

Jakarta - Pembiayaan lewat skema kerja sama pemerintah dan badan usaha (KPBU) mutlak dibutuhkan demi mewujudkan target pembangunan infrastruktur periode 2020-2024. Berdasarkan data Ditjen Pembiayaan Infrastruktur Kementerian PUPR yang diterima detikcom, Rabu (6/11/2019), masih ada Rp 1.435 triliun gap pembiayaan pembangunan infrastruktur yang dibutuhkan. Proyek yang akan dibangun tersebut mencakup bidang sumber daya air (SDA) Rp 577 triliun, jalan dan jembatan Rp 573 triliun, perumahan Rp 780 triliun, dan lainnya Rp 128 triliun.Kemampuan APBN dalam untuk proyek-proyek tersebut diperkirakan hanya mencakup 30% dari total biaya yang dibutuhkan atau sekitar Rp 623 triliun. Sementara total kebutuhan pembiayaan infrastruktur hingga 2024 mencapai Rp 2.058 triliun."Kalau lihat angka, realisasi PPP (public private partnership/KPBU) di PUPR 5 tahun kemarin masih rendah. Kami mendorong realisasi lebih besar," kata Dirjen Pembiayaan Infrastruktur Kementerian PUPR Eko D Heripurwanto saat ditemui di sela acara Indonesia Infrastructure Week di JIExpo Kemayoran, Jakarta.Untuk periode 2015-2019, tercatat realisasi pembiayaan KPBU/PPP proyek SPAM hanya mencapai 19% dari target pembiayaan Rp 20,15 triliun. Begitu pula dengan realisasi KPBU untuk proyek jalan tol yang hanya mencapai 28% dari target yang sebesar Rp 500 triliun.Peran swasta pun diharapkan bisa lebih besar dalam mewujudkan pembangunan infrastruktur yang diinginkan. Untuk proyek strategis nasional saja, kebutuhan pembiayaannya mencapai Rp 864 triliun yang mencakup 120 proyek."Dulu yang diutamakan APBN, sisanya ditawarkan. Sekarang tawarkan dulu KPBU, baru sisanya APBN," kata Eko.Simak Video "Periode Kedua, Jokowi Tetap Lanjutkan Pembangunan Infrastruktur"[Gambas:Video 20detik](eds/dna)

Jokowi Needs Rp 1,435 T in Private Assistance to Build Infrastructure
Nov 6 2019, 07:17 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Photo: Agung Pambudhy

Jakarta - Financing through a government and business cooperation (PPP) scheme is absolutely needed to realize the infrastructure development target for the 2020-2024 period. Based on data from the Directorate General of Infrastructure Financing at the Ministry of Public Works and Housing (PUPR) received by AFP on Wednesday (11/06/2019), there is still Rp 1,435 trillion in gap in the financing of infrastructure development needed. The projects that will be built include water resources (SDA) sector worth Rp. 577 trillion, roads and bridges Rp. 573 trillion, housing for Rp. 780 trillion, and others Rp. 128 trillion. The ability of the APBN in these projects is estimated to only cover 30% of the total the costs needed or around Rp 623 trillion. While the total infrastructure financing needs to reach 2024 trillion until 2024. "If you look at the figures, the realization of PPP (public private partnership / PPP) in PUPR 5 years ago is still low. We encourage greater realization," said Director General of Infrastructure Financing at the Ministry of PUPR E Heripurwanto when met on the sidelines of the Indonesia Infrastructure Week event at JIExpo Kemayoran, Jakarta. For the 2015-2019 period, recorded SPB project PPP / PPP financing realization only reached 19% of the funding target of Rp 20.15 trillion. Likewise, the realization of PPP for toll road projects which only reached 28% of the target of Rp 500 trillion. The private sector is also expected to be greater in realizing the desired infrastructure development. For national strategic projects, the funding needs reach Rp 864 trillion which includes 120 projects. "Previously, prioritizing the State Budget, the rest was offered. Now offer the PPP first, then the rest the state budget," said Eko.Simak Video "Second Period, Jokowi Continues to Continue Infrastructure Development "[Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (eds / dna)
